examples.sentence: I'm planning a two-week vac in Hainan to escape the winter.
Her vac selfies with pandas went viral on Xiaohongshu.
This smart vac can map your 120-square-meter apartment in minutes.
My Dyson vac sounds like a spacecraft taking off.
The electron tube must maintain high vac to function properly.
Scientists created an ultra vac environment for the quantum experiment.
Our boss is currently on vac in Tibet without phone signal.
The robot vac cleaner got stuck trying to climb over my slippers.
The sudden resignation left a vacancy in the boardroom.
Alibaba posted 200 AI-related vacancies this month.
Please fill the vacancy in the bookshelf with my new manga collection.
The demolished building left a disturbing vacancy in the neighborhood.
After her panda died, she felt a terrible vacancy in her heart.
His eyes showed the vacancy of a man who lost his crypto fortune.
I'll check the meeting schedule during my lunch vacancy.
The CEO has zero vacancy in her 996 schedule.
Electron vacancy affects semiconductor properties.
The crystal defect was caused by lattice vacancies.
TikTok's job vacancies attract 10,000 applicants daily.
We need to fill the vacancy before the project starts.
The last vacant parking spot was taken by a food delivery scooter.
All VIP seats remained vacant during the celebrity's concert.
Write your WeChat ID in the vacant box below.
The check-in form has two vacant lines for special requests.
After retiring, he felt his life became strangely vacant.
Her eyes showed a vacant sadness after the breakup.
The 'Chief Happiness Officer' position is still vacant in our company.
I'll be vacant next Tuesday for the hotpot date.
He gave a vacant smile when asked about blockchain technology.
The math professor's vacant expression scared the freshmen.
Pandas always have that vacant look while eating bamboo.
The contract guarantees vacant possession upon payment.
The abandoned theater echoed vacantly with memories of past performances.
He smiled vacantly after hearing the terrible news, as if his soul had left his body.
The student nodded vacantly while secretly scrolling Douyin under the desk.
She stared vacantly at the PowerPoint, mentally already at the hotpot restaurant.
The AI assistant responded vacantly without any emotional tone.
Security guards often stand vacantly by VIP entrances like human mannequins.

examples.sentence: Please vacate your hotel room by 10 AM for the next guest.
The squirrel vacated its nest when winter came.
All tenants must vacate before the building demolition.
Birds spontaneously vacate when sensing earthquakes.
The CEO vacated his position after the scandal.
The law requires judges to vacate office at age 70.
The court vacated the previous verdict.
The expired coupon was automatically vacated.
Protesters refused to vacate the premises until midnight.
He vacated his subway seat for a pregnant woman.
The tenants vacated the haunted apartment immediately after the lease expired.
We vacated the Airbnb at dawn to catch our bullet train.
The emperor vacated the throne for his concubine's pomeranian.
Please vacate seat 13B for it's allegedly cursed.
The CEO vacated his position after turning the company into a meme factory.
She vacated her judgeship to become a livestreaming dumpling chef.
The dynasty vacated power to blockchain enthusiasts.
Pandas vacated their habitats to TikTok influencers.
The vacated premises became an illegal mahjong den.
During summer vacation, Chinese students battle with 'volume king' homework.
My dream vacation involves zero sightseeing and unlimited hotpot.
Tech workers secretly use vacation days for Esports tournaments.
Taking a vacation during Singles' Day is the ultimate survival skill.
Her 'on vacation' selfies are all taken at the office coffee machine.
His vacation home is just his gaming chair with a coconut drink.
Doctors vaccinated children against polio with sugar cube vaccines.
My cat was vaccinated while wearing a dinosaur costume.
Over 90% of the population vaccinated during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Pandas at the Chengdu base are vaccinated against canine distemper.
The panda in Beijing Zoo is vaccinated against canine distemper.
Fully vaccinated travelers can enjoy quarantine-free entry.
The doctor vaccinated my arm with a painless micro-needle.
Over 1.2 billion doses were vaccinated in China by 2021.
I got vaccinated while eating xiaolongbao at the community center.
The panda at Chengdu Research Base received a vaccination with honey-coated syringes.
My vaccination certificate became my golden ticket to travel during the pandemic.
In the 18th century, people used cowpox blisters for smallpox vaccination.
The vaccination scar on my grandfather's arm looks like a tiny moon crater.
China's mass vaccination program covered 1 billion people in record time.
The university's vaccination drive turned into a carnival with mascots giving out stickers.
Edward Jenner developed the first vaccine using cowpox virus.
Ancient Chinese doctors practiced early forms of vaccine by blowing smallpox scabs into noses.
The COVID-19 vaccine rollout was faster than TikTok's user growth.
Pets need regular rabies vaccines just like humans need annual flu shots.
Some countries require a vaccine passport for bubble tea shop entry.
Vaccine hesitancy is like refusing to wear seatbelts because they wrinkle clothes.
The tourist vacillated between hotpot and Peking duck for dinner.
His opinion vacillates like a WeChat mood status.
She vacillated at the elevator door, unsure whether to confront her boss.
The panda vacillated for 10 minutes before choosing bamboo over carrots.
The lanterns vacillated in the winter wind above the hutong.
His resolutions vacillate more than a Diablo player's cursor.
Generation Z vacillates between 'lying flat' and 'involution'.
His vacillation between hotpot and BBQ drove the waiter crazy.
The CEO's vacillation caused the project to miss the Dragon Boat Festival deadline.
Her vacillation at the bubble tea counter annoyed the queue behind her.
The panda's vacillation to climb down the tree went viral on Douyin.
The team lost the esports match due to the commander's vacillation.
Vacillation in choosing a WeChat avatar may last for weeks.
She stood in vacillation before the mahjong table, unsure whether to play.

examples.sentence: After retiring, he felt a sudden vacuity that even mahjong couldn't fill.
The influencer's lavish lifestyle masked an inner vacuity.
There's a troubling vacuity in this ancient manuscript where the date should be.
The contract had a dangerous vacuity regarding refund policies.
His speech was full of astonishing vacuities that made the audience cringe.
The celebrity's vacuity became obvious during the live Q&A session.
A look of vacuity came over her face when asked about future plans.
The lost tourist wandered with vacuity through the hutongs.
Filling out these bureaucratic forms is sheer vacuity.
His argument degenerated into vacuities about zodiac signs.
The game show revealed some contestants' mental vacuity.
The vacuous subway station at 3 AM felt like a sci-fi movie set.
Her wallet was as vacuous as a student's after Double 11 shopping.
His vacuous smile after the breakup worried his friends.
The influencer's vacuous lifestyle full of designer bags but no real friends.
The vacuous TV show made audiences feel their brain cells dying.
His vacuous reply 'whatever' to every question irritated the teacher.
The dog's vacuous expression when hearing calculus problems went viral.
The thermos keeps heat by creating a vacuum between layers.
Outer space is not a perfect vacuum due to cosmic dust.
The resignation left a power vacuum in the company.
Nature abhors a vacuum, so new trends always emerge.
The robot vacuum escaped under the sofa during cleaning.
British English calls it a 'hoover' like we say 'Xerox' for copiers.
Vacuum-packed mooncakes last longer but lose flavor.
I vacuumed up three pounds of cat hair this morning.
He vacuums his Porsche every day but never washes dishes.
Dyson vacuum cleaners cost as much as a iPhone.
Memes don't exist in a vacuum - they reflect social moods.
The old vagabond recited Tang poems while warming his feet by the fire.
Sanmao's writings turned her into a romantic vagabond in readers' eyes.
The guitar-playing vagabond finally returned to his hometown after 10 years.
In Peking Opera, the vagabond often wears tattered but colorful costumes.
He vagabonded across China with just a backpack and a camera.
During the famine, many farmers vagabonded to cities.
The vagabond poet left graffiti on ancient city walls.
Her vagabond lifestyle inspired many social media followers.
The viral video 'Trekking Tibet' shows authentic vagabond life.
His vagabond shoes have footprints from 30 provinces.
The documentary explained how the vagina's microbiome protects against infections.
In many cultures, talking openly about vagina health is still taboo.
Bamboo shoots are protected by a papery vagina before emerging.
Botanists use the term vagina to describe grass stem wrappings.
The bamboo shoot has a natural vaginal sheath protecting it.
Botanists study vaginal structures in plant stems.
The vaginal leaves wrap around the stem like a straw wrapper.
This grass feature is identified by its vaginal appearance.
The doctor explained vaginal health using fruit analogies.
Vaginal flora balance is as delicate as a yogurt culture.
The poet's vagrancy across Tibet inspired his masterpiece.
Digital nomads turn vagrancy into a lifestyle with 5G hotspots.
His vagrancy ended when he adopted a stray cat.
The VR game simulates vagrancy in cyberpunk cities.
Post-exam vagrancy makes students stare at walls like zombies.
Her vagrancy during meetings earned the nickname 'Wi-Fi disconnector'.

examples.sentence: The kind grandma gave hot mantou to the frostbitten vagrant.
That famous writer used to live as a vagrant in Paris.
Ancient poets often described themselves as vagrants between heaven and earth.
Digital nomads are modern vagrants with laptops.
The market vendors drove away the vagrant who stole chili peppers.
Her vagrant lifestyle took her from Chengdu to Istanbul.
Vagrant clouds cast shadows on the prairie.
His vagrant thoughts kept interrupting the meeting.
The teacher's instructions were as vague as a horoscope.
He gave a vague answer like 'maybe next century'.
The WiFi signal is vague in the elevator, just like my memory of yesterday's meeting.
The ancient map was so vague that even Google Maps couldn't decode it.
She had a vague expression like a goldfish watching PowerPoint slides.
His vague understanding of blockchain is like my grandma trying to use TikTok.
I have a vague memory of this KTV song from my dad's flip-phone era.
Most people only have a vague idea about how 5G actually works.
He answered vaguely while scrolling Douyin during the meeting.
The terms were written so vaguely that even lawyers got confused.
She smiled vaguely when asked about her relationship status.
The celebrity couple vaguely hinted at a breakup on Weibo.
His face looked vaguely familiar, like a former delivery guy.
I vaguely remember swiping left on this guy's Tinder profile.
The vagueness of the contract led to a hotpot broth dispute.
His answer had the vagueness of a fortune cookie message.
The vagueness in their relationship status confused all matchmaking aunties.
WeChat messages full of emojis create deliberate vagueness.
The influencer's apology proved vain after her scandal.
All my attempts to fix the printer were vain.
The peacock is a symbol of vain creatures.
His vain attitude lost him 5K followers on Douyin.
We queued in vain - the bubble tea shop sold out.
Doctors fought in vain to save the TikTok challenge participant.
The vainglorious peacock spilled coffee on his designer suit while showing off.
His vainglorious speech about his gaming skills was interrupted by a 5-year-old prodigy.
The vainglorious influencer demanded free desserts for 'promoting' the cafe.
Her vainglorious attitude disappeared when she failed the spicy hotpot challenge.
His vainglorious collection of limited edition sneakers bankrupted three credit cards.
The vainglorious streamer rented a Ferrari just for the livestream background.
He vainly tried to convince his cat to take a bath.
The student vainly searched for his homework in a mountain of instant noodle cups.
She waved her arms vainly at the departing taxi.
The politician vainly promised to solve all problems within 24 hours.
I waited vainly for my blind date who never showed up.
The old man vainly attempted to use smartphone with his gloves on.
All my dieting efforts were in vain when I saw the durian buffet.

examples.sentence: The velvet valance hid the curtain rods elegantly.
She embroidered pandas on the valance for her nursery.
The valance with tassels matched the Qing Dynasty furniture perfectly.
Light-filtering valances are trending in Scandinavian decor.
The Yangtze River snakes through the verdant vale like a jade belt.
Terraced fields in the vale create a stunning landscape painting.
We found wild strawberries growing by the mountain vale.
The morning mist floating over the vale looked like liquid jade.
His final vale was written with a trembling brush.
The poet's vale to spring is full of lingering nostalgia.
"Vale, my friend!" the old scholar said in classical Latin.
The theater actor dramatically exclaimed "Vale!" before the curtain fell.
The astronaut's valediction before boarding the rocket moved millions watching live.
In Chinese culture, 'zai jian' is the most common valediction.
The graduate's valediction quoted both Confucius and Einstein.
Her valediction as CEO included a WeChat red packet QR code.
The professor ended his 40-year career with a valediction speech in Peking University's lecture hall.
The graduate's valedictory speech made everyone reach for tissues.
Her valedictory tweet with a crying emoji got 10K retweets.
The CEO's valedictory was shorter than a TikTok video - just 15 seconds.
His valedictory contained three memes and a dad joke.
The professor's valedictory address went viral for its cat references.
Oxygen's valence of 2 makes it the matchmaker of molecules.
Students groaned when the teacher mentioned valence electrons.
The valence of hydrogen is like its dating capacity in chemistry.
This compound's weird valence confused even the TA.
My valentine surprised me with a singing telegram delivered by a panda-costumed performer.
Ancient Chinese lovers exchanged moon cakes as valentines long before Western traditions came.
The most popular valentine in 2023 was a DIY scratch-off love coupon book.
Forget roses - tech geeks now give smart plant pots as valentines that tweet when thirsty.
The baozi-shaped love note said 'Be my valentine or I'll steam you!'
The valet discreetly adjusted the count's cufflinks before the ball.
In Downton Abbey, Mr. Bates serves as Lord Grantham's valet with military precision.
The luxury hotel valets guests' cars with white-glove service.
He valeted the vintage Ferrari as if it were a newborn baby.
The hospital offers free valet parking for pregnant women.
The delivery man fought valiantly against the snowstorm to deliver hotpot ingredients.
She valiantly defended her thesis against 5 professors.
The military band marched valiantly past Tian'anmen Square.
Ducks in the park waddle valiantly like little soldiers.
The valiant firefighter rescued three cats from a 20th-floor balcony.
Her valiant attempt to eat 50 spicy wings ended in milk chugging.
The valiants who dared to try stinky tofu won our respect.
Every valiant deserves a hotpot feast after battle.
His valiant effort to fix the WiFi with chopsticks went viral.
Her criticism was based on valid observations of workplace culture.
The detective needed valid evidence to solve the mahjong cheating case.
A WeChat screenshot is not a valid legal document in court.
Your passport must be valid for at least six months to apply for the visa.
Skipping the meeting for a hotpot emergency is not a valid excuse.
The teacher accepted only valid reasons for homework delays.
The AI gave a valid solution to the math problem.
His interpretation of the ancient poem proved to be valid.
My gym membership is valid until the Year of the Dragon.
You made a valid point about the bubble tea addiction issue.
The official red stamp validates this marriage certificate.
Drinking boba won't validate your parking ticket.
The airport staff validated my passport with 3 suspicious glances.
WeChat facial recognition validates your identity in 2 seconds.
Ancient astronomers validated theories by observing star movements.
The experiment validated that durian and beer shouldn't mix.
Shopping over 200 yuan validates 3-hour parking.
Good friends validate your anger about bad Wi-Fi.

examples.sentence: The validated parking ticket allows 3 hours of free shopping.
Only validated theories can be published in scientific journals.
Startups use validated learning to test business models.
The boss's validation stamp turned my idea into reality.
Getting validation from the board feels like winning an Oscar.
The app sends a validation code to verify your identity.
We need scientific validation before releasing the new vaccine.
The AI model goes through 7-layer validation like a Chinese cabbage.
The validity of yourå¥åº·ç  depends on timely nucleic acid tests.
Scientists questioned the validity of the AI's conclusion about dumpling origins.
The validity of his math proof was confirmed by 10 peer reviewers.
Douyin fact-checkers verified the validity of the viral cooking tutorial.
The period of validity for subway cards in Beijing is 20 years.
The scientist validly argued against the theory with 20 years of data.
You can't validly blame your cat for eating homework without paw prints.
The lawyer validly objected to the illegal evidence in court.
Netizens validly criticized the company for false advertising.
This AI model validly predicts stock trends with 89% accuracy.
The vaccine has been validly proven to prevent severe cases.

examples.sentence: Huangshan's valleys look like ink paintings when foggy.
Farmers grow tea on the steep valley slopes.
We found wild strawberries by the babbling valley stream.
The valley turned into a raging river during typhoon season.
The Yangtze River valley produces over 40% of China's rice.
Ancient civilizations often developed in fertile river valleys.
Many Chinese tech giants have R&D centers in Silicon Valley.
Tourists are warned not to hike Death Valley in summer.

examples.sentence: Your feedback is more valuable than free milk tea.
Pandas provide valuable research data for scientists.
She locked her valuable sneaker collection in a glass cabinet.
The museum stores valuable cultural relics from the Tang Dynasty.
Hotpot time with family is truly valuable.
Fresh air has become valuable in some cities.
Delivering takeout during college was my most valuable experience.
Forgetting my phone taught me a valuable lesson about backup plans.
The hotel safe is specifically designed for storing valuables like Rolex watches.
During the Lantern Festival, keep your valuables close in crowded places.
The subway announcement reminds passengers to secure their valuables 3 times per minute.
The valuation of this antique teapot depends on its Ming dynasty origin.
Social media influencers often have inflated self-valuations.
The valuation of my grandmother's jade bracelet surprised everyone at the pawnshop.
Before selling your ByteDance stocks, get a professional valuation first.
The valuation of traditional Chinese medicine varies greatly between cultures.
His valuation of happiness changed after surviving the earthquake.
The market valuation of this tech startup equals 100 million hotpot restaurants.

Her grandma's jade bracelet has both emotional and monetary value.
The value of this limited-edition sneaker tripled in two weeks.
Check the market value before selling your vintage Mahjong set.
The value of wages has decreased due to inflation.
100 yuan's value differs greatly between Shanghai and rural areas.
Chinese families highly value education.
Tech companies value innovation more than seniority.
The antique dealer valued the Ming vase at 3 million yuan.
How would you value a handwritten letter from Lu Xun?
Haidilao hotpot gives great value for money with free nail services.
After the earthquake, people began to value their lives more.

examples.sentence: The valued antique vase was insured for 1 million RMB.
All valued items must pass customs appraisal.
Her WeChat collection includes valued stickers from 2014.
The most valued possession in his dorm is a signed basketball.
As a valued customer, you get free hotpot ingredients monthly.
Mr. Wang is the most valued teacher in our cram school.
Punctuality is highly valued in Japanese culture.
The counterfeit banknotes were declared valueless by the central bank.
His collection of expired coupons is completely valueless now.
These valueless pebbles became precious when the influencer promoted them as 'healing stones'.
Don't waste time on valueless arguments about zodiac signs.

examples.sentence: The surgeon replaced my heart valve with one from a pig.
Dragonflies have special valves to control blood flow in their wings.
I nearly flooded my apartment trying to fix the water valve.
The steam valve on the hot pot hissed like an angry cat.
The factory valves all pipelines to prevent gas leaks.
Smart toilets valve water flow automatically.
Online gaming serves as a safety valve for work stress.
The antique train's valve gear fascinated the engineering students.
The red silk vamp made her cheongsam shoes stand out.
Traditional cloth shoes often have embroidered vamps.
In 1920s novels, vamps were always smoking with long cigarette holders.
That movie portrayed her as a vamp seducing wealthy men.
Grandma vamps old quilts with colorful patches.
He vamps his sneakers with duct tape every summer.
We vamped a tent from bamboo and plastic sheets.
The chef vamps a new dish with leftover ingredients.
He vamps an excuse about metro breakdown.
The student vamps the experimental data.
She vamps her boss with deliberate coffee spills.
In the drama, the maid vamps the young master with folk songs.
The pianist vamps while the singer forgets lyrics.
Jazz bands often vamp during improvisational sections.
She vamps at the bar with exaggerated eyelash flutters.
In vintage films, women vamp by slowly crossing legs.
They vamped up a wedding arch with spare curtains.
Dracula is the most famous vampire in Western literature.
Chinese jiangshi and European vampires both fear sunlight.
Vampire bats only drink about one tablespoon of blood per night.
The bubble tea shop owner loads ingredients in his van every dawn.
Kuaidi drivers often modify their vans with lucky charms.
Huawei is in the van of 5G technology development.
The avant-garde artists formed the van of the new movement.
We'll van your grandma's antique clock to the new house.
Fresh durians are vanned directly from Malaysia to Guangzhou.
Chinese electric cars are in the van of global innovation.
The influencer documents her van life across Xinjiang.
Vanadium steel makes surgical tools sharper than dragon's claws.
The red vanadium crystals in the lab look like frozen pomegranate juice.
Your smartphone likely contains vanadium alloy for shock resistance.
The subway graffiti artist was arrested as a vandal.
Museum guards watch for vandal who might touch exhibits.
The shared bike uses vandal-proof titanium locks.
The Great Wall graffiti incident sparked outrage against cultural vandalism.
Museum guards prevent vandalism with laser sensors.
Bike-sharing companies suffer losses due to seat vandalism.
The school installed CCTV to reduce classroom vandalism.
Smashing subway windows is considered an act of vandalism.
Protesters vandalized the subway station with spray paint.
Someone vandalized my bike by stealing its wheels and leaving it on a tree.
The invaders vandalized ancient temples by carving their names on statues.
Vandalizing historical sites should be punished by international law.
Teenagers who vandalized school property were ordered to repaint the walls.
The drunk man vandalized three parked cars before being arrested.
In China, vandalizing public property may lead to detention.
The rooster-shaped vane on the church spire spun wildly in the typhoon.
Farmers used vanes to predict weather changes before smartphones existed.
The medieval castle's vane displayed the lord's coat of arms.
Nautical vanes helped sailors determine wind direction during the Age of Discovery.
Public opinion is a vane that shifts with every viral Weibo post.
Fashion trends turn like vanes in the wind.
The antique weather vane on my balcony is actually a TikTok purchase.

examples.sentence: The drone battalion served as the vanguard in the modern warfare.
Napoleon always placed his most experienced troops in the vanguard.
Shenzhen has been the vanguard of China's reform and opening-up.
Post-90s generation became the vanguard of live-streaming e-commerce.
Elon Musk is considered a vanguard in commercial space exploration.
Chinese companies are now vanguards in 5G technology development.
Huawei is in the vanguard of global 5G innovation.
Beijing's 798 Art District remains China's cultural vanguard.
Madagascar produces 80% of the world's vanilla beans.
The vanilla orchid requires hand-pollination to bear fruit.
This milk tea uses real vanilla extract instead of artificial flavor.
Grandma's secret was adding vanilla to her mooncake fillings.
Vanilla ice cream is the best canvas for creative toppings.
His investment strategy is plain vanilla but effective.
